definition: bookworm
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Who are the biggest bookworms in the country?
Students shouldn't be only bookworms on campus; they should be informed of what's going on in the world.
sentences.chinese: 學生不應只是象牙塔裏的書蟲，他們應該瞭解世事。

sentences.english: I like Book Worm very much. It also helps me make a big progress in English.
sentences.chinese: 《書蟲》是一套非常實用的英語讀物。

sentences.english: A. Bella is a first and foremost a bookworm.
sentences.chinese: 貝拉是個一等一的書蟲。

sentences.english: They believe that people who read are nerds, gees or bookworms.
sentences.chinese: 他們相信人讀都是讓人厭煩的傢伙，滑稽演員或書蟲。

sentences.english: The Sunday The Bookworms completed their knapsacks and we hung them up in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 另一組書蟲們完成其揹包，我們掛他們在課堂上。

sentences.english: Ren Jing considers herself a bit of a bookworm.
sentences.chinese: 任靜自認爲她可能有點像書蟲。

sentences.english: The Sunday Bookworms completed their knapsacks and we hung them up in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 另一組書蟲們完成其揹包，我們掛他們在課堂上。

sentences.english: Nerdy environmentalism is Mr Gore's forte.
sentences.chinese: 書蟲式的環境保護主義正是戈爾先生的拿手好戲。

sentences.english: Nine months later, the bookworms and the geeks are the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 九個月之後，書蟲和技術宅成爲了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Bookworms salute International Literacy Day, designed to increase their number.
sentences.chinese: “書蟲”慶祝國際讀書日，計劃壯大他們的隊伍。

definition: to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
bird's nest
anecdote/fantastic story
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
the mantis stalks the cicada, unaware of the oriole behind (idiom, from Daoist classic Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); to pursue a narrow gain while neglecting a greater danger
contemporary drama
to read in silence
trade wind
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
interlude/to cross the stage/to do sth as a mere formality/to go through the motions
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
children's picture story book/CL:本[ben3]
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
calm and composed (idiom)
